Phylowood: interactive web-based animations of biogeographic and phylogeographic histories

Landis MJ, Bedford T. 2014. Bioinformatics 30: 123-124.
PDF
landis-phylowood.pdf
DOI
10.1093/bioinformatics/btt635
Source code
github.com/mlandis/phylowood

Abstract

Summary: Phylowood is a web service that uses Javascript to generate in-browser animations of biogeographic and phylogeographic histories from annotated phylogenetic input. The animations are interactive, allowing the user to adjust spatial and temporal resolution, and highlight phylogenetic lineages of interest.

Availability: All documentation and source code for Phylowood is freely available at github.com/mlandis/phylowood and a live web application is available at mlandis.github.io/phylowood.
